text:
Back in 2008 the PS2 I was using to play this finally died right after I got to the final dungeon. Never did finish it. I'd had the game since Christmas 1998 too, but didn't play more than like 2/3rds of the 1st disc I think until 2008 when I started it over.

Been so long I've forgotten a lot of the details/text of the story, would feel wrong just playing it from the end again.

Think it was the disc drive that died, was making grinding noises and stuff, then I think it stopped being able to read the discs, iirc.
author: dimeuno

text: so much xenogear in it *c*
author: Evilriku13

text: Such a good game, shame it was cut short on the second disk. music has always been one of my fav things about this game. brings back so many memories.
author: william rankin

text: I remember when I saw this game in stores... I took a chance on it based solely on the cover art. I hadn't even noticed it was a Squaresoft game until after I bought it... It was one of the greatest games I've ever played in my life. The story (although at the time I couldn't fully comprehend it as a child), the gameplay, the strategy, the music, the characters... I definitely want to replay it again soon. I love Xenogears... I just wish their original plans came to fruition.
author: Drew [makes] Beats

text: this is Squaresoft's greatest masterpiece, music, storyline, gameplay, etc, wish they would make a remake or a second part
author: AshCrimsom

text: I'm playing Xenogears for the first time for about more than a month now, I'm almost at the end of the 1st disc and the story is getting REALLY WEIRD. It's like a mixture of '90s Japanese plots all together, it's nuts. The game is alright for the most part, but since I'm not too far from the end I'd like to ask this: is Xenosaga worth it? I've heard people disliking it, especially the sequels. It's like a trilogy, right? Is each chapter a different story or are they all connected?
author: Gyro

text: Xenosaga 3 is a very good game. 1 has an interesting plot but really long battles (exacerbated by the fact that there is only one battle theme) and terrible pacing. 2 is largely not relevant to the story and has a very clunky combat system. I'd say just get 3, it recaps the plot of the first 2 games.
author: OyVeey

text: So I know that the second game is disappointing, but is there really nothing worth experiencing by playing the first game? Like some moments that are worth playing in person instead of just watching a recap of it.
author: Gyro

text:
@RagingNeku
Most of the highlights of XS1 are cutscene related - it does have some awesome space battle and acid trip scenes, but you can just YouTube those. It does have a battle system more reminiscent of Xenogears (compared to XS3 which is more similar to FFX's menu-based system) with the added option to mount or dismount a mech any time, and field encounters instead of random battles, which is cool. And it has a couple pretty fun minigames. Get it if you really want, but if you hate it don't let that put you off XS3.
author: OyVeey

text: @OyVeey 3 it is, then. Thanks for the advice. I wish there was a HD Collection for this trilogy, so I could at least check out all of them.
author: Gyro

text: It is funny how for years I never noticed that Xenosagas 1 track "Opening" had a portion of it at 3:09 off of this song Awakening a nod to Omen even though I loved both games.and they have the same title. Not until I re listened to it just now did I catch it. Â damn the feels are strong. It just goes to show haw Yasunori Mitsuda really wanted to carry the theme of his first ost into the next generation of the series as a love for it and a homage for the fans. Shame they did not keep him for the remainder of the Xeno series. Even Joanne Hogg got to sing songs for both games.

Maybe I need to finish the game to realize that it is really good, or maybe it's nostalgia, which of course I don't have for this.

text: The first big game Mitsuda fully composed, the soundtrack has a lot of similarities with his work on Chrono Trigger. Xenogears is probably the PS1 RPG I most want to replay. As a big fan of the Xenosaga trilogy's story, I'll be happy to get back into the Xeno universe.
